results.title: Energy and agriculture
results.creator_credit: CSIRO, Nicholas Alexander and Chris Oliver
results.brief_description: Suggests ways of cutting down on energy use in agriculture. Shows how technological change and scientific research can expand the man-on-the-land’s role of producing food energy to the production of liquid fuels such as methanol and ethanol.

results.title: Energy
results.brief_description: Shows the mining of coal, its conversion into electrical energy, and the problems enocuntered in this conversion such as the disposal of waste products. Also looks at atomic power stations and their inherent problems. The concept of tidal power as an alternative source is mentioned. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Energy
results.creator_credit: Oxford Films (U.S.), Arthur G. Evans and Barbara Buce
results.brief_description: Explores energy in humans, animals, the elements and the earth. Shows how these kinds of energy are harnessed and how they are used daily in home and industry. Shows that pollution is a result of excessive use and barren devastation is a result of a lack of conservation. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Energetics of life
results.creator_credit: FilmFair Communications, Mallory Pearce, Daniel E. Atkinson and E.A. Carlson
results.brief_description: Treats the types and functions of energy in living things - kinetic and potential energy; thermodynamics; free energy and chemical energy. Described in detail are the structure and function of the ATP molecule; photosynthesis; the metabolism of glucose. Emphasizes the ability of the ATP molecule to harness solar energy and use it

results.title: Energetically yours
results.creator_credit: Transfilm, Walter Lowendahl and David Hilberman
results.brief_description: An animated film by Ronald Searle which traces man’s search for sources of energy to help him in his daily life. It tells of our need and use of energy since primitive times - from fire, through coal and oil, to the atom.

results.title: Enemy alien
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Wolf Koenig and Jeanette Lerman
results.brief_description: This is about a people who dared to ask: “What are they going to do with us?” The Japanese-Canadians fought long and hard to be accepted as Canadians. It is important that the long story of frustration and injustice, mistrust and hate, and eventual triumph should be remembered. This film tells that story. (Awards: New York; Birmingham.)

results.title: Endurance
results.brief_description: Originally photographed at the time of Shackleton’s attempt to cross Antarctica from the Weddell Sea to the Ross Sea, 1914-16. Travelling from Buenos Aires through 2,000 miles of pack ice, the ship ‘Endurance’ was frozen in and smashed by pressure. Retrieving supplies and three boats the party camped at Elephant Island, while Shackleton and five others set out in terrible cold for sixteen days journey to South Georgia whaling station. Forced to land on the wrong side of the island, they walked 36 hours over a 9,000 foot unexplored ridge to the whaling station. Four expeditions were organised before the main party was rescued without loss. Shows Shackleton’s later expedition in the ‘Quest’ ending with his death in 1922. Photography by Frank Hurley.
results.description: Originally photographed at the time of Shackleton’s attempt to cross Antarctica from the Weddell Sea to the Ross Sea, 1914-16. Retrieving supplies and three boats the party camped at Elephant Island, while Shackleton and five others set out in terrible cold for sixteen days journey to South Georgia whaling station. Forced to land on the wrong side of the island, they walked 36 hours over a 9,000 foot unexplored ridge to the whaling station. Four expeditions were organised before the main party was rescued without loss. Shows Shackleton’s later expedition in the ‘Quest’ ending with his death in 1922. Photography by Frank Hurley.

Four expeditions were organised before the main party was rescued without loss. Shows Shackleton’s later expedition in the ‘Quest’ ending with his death in 1922. Photography by Frank Hurley.

results.title: Endotracheal anaesthesia
results.creator_credit: Realist Films, ICI (GB) and Margaret Thomson
results.brief_description: Without a clear airway the administration of a general anaesthetic is impossible. This film shows how endotracheal anaesthesia overcomes this difficulty by intubation of the larynx. The advantages of endotrachael anaesthesia are summarised.
results.description: Without a clear airway the administration of a general anaesthetic is impossible. This film shows how endotracheal anaesthesia overcomes this difficulty by intubation of the larynx. The advantages of endotrachael anaesthesia are summarised.

results.title: Endoscopic study of the prostate = Les Adenomes de la prostate etude endoscopique
results.brief_description: This film highlights the disease issues related to prostate medical condition focussing on the various issues arising with pre and post operation. In medical linguistics it explores the diverse complications of the prostatic cavity.

results.title: Endocrine system. 2nd edition.
results.brief_description: Locates the major glands of the endocrine system and discusses the contribution of each to reproduction, growth, metabolism and the maintenance of homeostasis. Explains the regulatory mechanism of feedback as well as diabetes and goitre.
